newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila shares sputter at close after initial spurt.
newsitem.headline: Manila shares sputter at close after initial spurt.

text.p: Late-session profit-taking pared early gains by Manila shares as investors remained defensive amid the fragile foreign exchange and money markets, brokers said.
"There was some follow-through buying but it was supported by relatively light turnover, so it was not sustained," Juanis Barredo, a technical analyst of Citisecurities, said.
He said even some secondary and tertiary issues which led the active gainers lost steam by late session.
"This indicates a negative sentiment in the market," Barredo said.
The composite index eked out a minimal 0.25 point rise to settle at 2,592.46 points.

Uncertainties still ruled the foreign exchange and money markets despite the three-percentage point cut in the central bank's benchmark rates. The regional currencies were still under pressure from speculators.
Noel Reyes, vice president of Anscor Hagedorn Securities, said economic fundamentals remained unclear especially after the de facto devaluation of the peso earlier this month.
"We do see the downward drift to continue in the coming days," Barredo said.
Among the most heavily traded issues were PLDT which remained unchanged at 925 pesos and Metropolitan Bank and Trust Co Inc which rose five pesos to 545 pesos.
